column4: how do i upgrade from hoary preview to the official hoary? or is it done automatically? (i simply keep my system updated for now with the taskbar tool)
alrighty, thanks.
also, where is the 'proper' place to get mplayer from? when im using marillat's amd64 packages for some odd reason it fails to work with -ao alsa.. only -ao oss..
use -ao sdl :p
what's wrong with using alsa directly?
Using it is discouraged in the mplayer manual
really? i wonder what's the reason for that discouragement. seems perfectly logical to me to use alsa..
They say in the manual that it's buggy.
From my limited knowledge of the linux sound system, im pretty sure that using SDL generally means using alsa anyways.
yeah.
so what you're saying makes little sense. it just means that mplayer may be alsa-buggy, not alsa itself.
That's what I'm telling you. :p
sorry, i assumed you were saying that the mplayer guys are saying that alsa itself is buggy :)
what I said.
i know, but if i installed an sdl version that uses alsa, it shouldn't matter that some legacy app is using /dev/dsp
it does matter.
afaik, alsa will simply mix /dev/dsp along with every other channel.
i know what is it, i just assumed that a process using /dev/dsp doesn't mean that you can't use alsa directly at the same time.
yes.
weeird. ok. thanks for the correction.
we've been through that, i know :) i just assumed it emulated it and simply treated it as just one sound channel it needs to mix with the rest.
a proper sound card will do hardware mixing
yes i know that, but that's driver-level. alsa can do software mixing as well.
